intro: Metastelma thysanotum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its flowers are usually clustered in racemes and attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic properties.
